typeQuestions.text: Since I believe good relationships bring value to both myself and others, I truly enjoy warm and sincere environments where people show love, care, support, and help each other.
Because I am clear and uncompromising about rules and responsibilities, my friends often say that I come across as strict and judgmental.
Since I try to avoid making mistakes and paying the price for them, I feel the need to consult people I trust and make decisions that are logical and unlikely to cause harm.
With my strong self-confidence and bold stance, I enjoy facing challenging situations that require courage and demonstrating my strength.
I usually have goals and focus on them intensely, creating long-term plans and strategies if necessary, and reaching results in the most effective way without getting caught up in rules.
When I am asked for help, I cannot remain indifferent because of my compassion and I try to give all the support I can.
I am very courageous, not afraid of conflict, and self-confident—someone who can quickly make decisions and take action even in the riskiest situations.
I feel a sense of sadness in my life in general; this feeling drives me to passionately search for the meaning and beauty that I lack.
I am someone who is interested in complex issues that require deep thinking and who researches thoroughly until I get to the bottom of things.
I can stand out in situations where most people shy away and hesitate, so people describe me as forceful, daring, and someone who doesn’t back down.
I am a person who does not dwell on past mistakes, loves innovation and change, and knows how to enjoy life by immediately experiencing things I’m curious about.
Because I am possessive, self-sacrificing, and think of others before myself, I feel deeply hurt when I don’t receive the same sensitivity in return.
Before sharing my thoughts and feelings, I feel the need to understand people well, grasp their intentions, and make sure they mean no harm.
I imagine positive things about the future and take great pleasure in realizing them; that’s why I’m drawn to exciting things, even if they’re risky.
When criticized, I feel like I’m being blamed and stay uneasy until I clarify in my mind whether I was wrong.
Since I focus on acting logically and correctly based on my principles, I try to identify my mistakes objectively and improve myself.
I work hard to reach my goals and make myself seen, often ignoring rules and details—because for me, failure is not an acceptable option.
When what is right and necessary is not done, I feel anger and criticize myself and others based on logic and principles.
I have a questioning mind and try to take precautions against danger and harm, so I need time to trust and make decisions.
I often feel the need to turn inward and reflect on my emotions to better understand myself and life with all its contradictions.
I try hard to maintain my calm and peace and avoid tension, so I usually avoid conflict and adapt as much as possible.
I can set aside my emotions when thinking, and I approach the topics I care about in a fully analytical and detailed way.
Even if it might upset others, I prefer to speak openly, clearly, and frankly without softening my words.
I need everything to be very clear and predictable; that’s why I place great importance on seeking advice from people who give reliable, logical, and clear guidance.
I care about expressing myself through unique things that bring deep meaning to life. Even if I’m not approved, I need to be understood as I truly am.
I try to understand things thoroughly before reacting quickly; however, if something doesn’t concern me, I tend not to share my opinion—even if I think it’s wrong.
I compare and question all the possible outcomes, and I make decisions only after I am completely sure.
I focus on the positive sides of life, get bored by tough conditions, and because I love my freedom, I ignore rules and restrictions that I find unnecessary.
I am a highly organized person who plans everything in detail and pushes every limit to get things done fully and on time.
Because I care about expressing myself completely and being understood as I am, I choose my words very carefully.
Even when I disagree inside, I respect others’ opinions and approaches and, unless they pressure me, I tend to accept them as they are.
I don’t give up easily in the face of threats or challenges—I rely on my strength and courage and take them head-on.
I don’t dwell on the past or negative possibilities; I look ahead with optimism and try to solve problems quickly.
I don’t let emotions waste my time or energy—I work with high motivation and believe there’s always a way to succeed.
Instead of talking about daily matters or emotions, I prefer to be alone and think, or share ideas with people who view life rationally.
I’m humble, flexible, easy-going, avoid putting myself in the spotlight, and try not to react harshly to mistakes.
Painful and sad things attract me deeply, and I think them through in great detail to draw meaning about life and myself.
I strive to stand out, compete, and stay self-motivated—even under stress or anxiety.
Even when some choices seem illogical, I tend to follow my intuition if I believe there’s meaning in the outcome.
I want those around me to feel joyful and relaxed, so I talk positively about the future and make clever jokes to lighten the mood.
I believe that sorrow and pain add great value to a person, so I fully experience them and reflect on the meaning of existence.
I get bored with routines and monotony; I struggle with patience and focus, but when something exciting or extraordinary comes up, I’m instantly energized.
I work in a disciplined and planned way until I complete my duties perfectly. If I feel something is missing, I don’t consider the job finished until I’ve addressed it.
I have difficulty expressing my feelings naturally, and even when I’m angry, I usually avoid showing it because I am patient and seek peace.
I’m uncomfortable with uncertainty and tend to worry, so I can’t relax until I resolve the uncertainty and clarify the situation.
I openly show love and care to my friends and want to share both my happiness and my sorrow with them.
I’m understanding and tolerant of others—even when they act wrongly—I accept them and avoid criticism, and I’m easy to get along with.
I believe image and appearance matter a lot, so I try to come across as talented, capable, and effective.
I need my life to be simple, calm, and free from emotional ups and downs, so I avoid tense and conflict-heavy environments.
I’m very sensitive to negative possibilities—I quickly detect risky or dangerous situations and try to take precautions.
I place great importance on sharing emotions and helping others—I try to meet people’s needs as best as I can to make them feel good.
I have a dominant and assertive style—so I like to have the final say, and when others oppose my thoughts or wishes, I get angry.
I observe my inner world and emotional pursuits a lot and often reflect deeply on my individuality and uniqueness.
I am principled, meticulous about rules, and have a high sense of responsibility. I don’t feel comfortable unless I do something thoroughly and right.
I strongly expect emotional warmth and closeness from those around me, and when I don’t get it, I feel lonely and try to express how I feel.
People often see me as hard to please and intolerant of flaws—but I believe things should be done thoroughly and the right way.
I don’t seek social interaction much and try to be self-sufficient—my worldview could be summed up as fewer possessions, fewer people.
I’m not fast-paced or impulsive—I try to handle things calmly and can easily go with the flow when needed.
I easily notice what others need and put in the effort to meet those needs so they won’t feel lonely or unhappy.
Being impressive, productive, and getting quick results is very important to me—I strive to be the best and earn admiration.
Before taking action on a problem, I carefully think through all possible outcomes—both good and bad—and act cautiously.
I know that strong emotions interfere with rational thinking, so I distance myself from people who talk excessively about their feelings and can’t think calmly.
Since I avoid tension, I usually don’t show my anger or point out mistakes. When I have to speak up, I do so as gently as possible.
I try to be consistent in my words and actions and fulfill all my responsibilities—so I expect others to do the same and will speak up when they don’t.
I take risks and responsibilities quickly and can say no when needed—so I’m good at taking control.
I relate to people who succeed despite adversity—because I’m also someone who knows how to turn challenges into opportunities.
I’m confident, decisive, and protective of those around me—my brave and assured stance gives others strength.
I’m cheerful, fun, practical, and don’t get stuck on negative emotions or small details.

When I’m curious about something, I want to understand it completely and try to answer my questions on my own first. When I’m curious about something, I want to get to the root of it and solve the questions in my mind on my own first.
